TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MediaMetadataRetriever extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: MediaMetadataRetriever class provides a unified interface for retrieving frame and meta data from an input media file.

remarks.para: MediaMetadataRetriever class provides a unified interface for retrieving frame and meta data from an input media file.

Docs.param: A containing a Java Native Interface (JNI) object reference.
Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string ExtractMetadata (Android.Media.MetadataKey keyCode);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string ExtractMetadata(valuetype Android.Media.MetadataKey keyCode) cil managed

Docs.param: One of the constants listed below at the end of the class.
Docs.summary: Call this method after setDataSource().

remarks.para:
Call this method after setDataSource(). This method retrieves the meta data value associated with the keyCode.
The keyCode currently supported is listed below as METADATA_XXX constants. With any other value, it returns a null pointer.

MemberSignature.Value: public string ExtractMetadata (int keyCode);
.method public hidebysig instance string ExtractMetadata(int32 keyCode) cil managed

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Graphics.Bitmap FrameAtTime { get; }
.property instance class Android.Graphics.Bitmap FrameAtTime

Docs.summary: Call this method after setDataSource().

remarks.para: Call this method after setDataSource(). This method finds a representative frame at any time position if possible, and returns it as a bitmap. This is useful for generating a thumbnail for an input data source. Call this method if one does not care about where the frame is located; otherwise, please call or

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual byte[] GetEmbeddedPicture ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] GetEmbeddedPicture() cil managed

Docs.summary: Call this method after setDataSource().

remarks.para: Call this method after setDataSource(). This method finds the optional graphic or album/cover art associated associated with the data source. If there are more than one pictures, (any) one of them is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Graphics.Bitmap GetFrameAtTime (long timeUs);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Graphics.Bitmap GetFrameAtTime(int64 timeUs) cil managed

Docs.param: The time position where the frame will be retrieved. When retrieving the frame at the given time position, there is no guarentee that the data source has a frame located at the position. When this happens, a frame nearby will be returned. If timeUs is negative, time position and option will ignored, and any frame that the implementation considers as representative may be returned.
Docs.summary: Call this method after setDataSource().

remarks.para: Call this method after setDataSource(). This method finds a representative frame close to the given time position if possible, and returns it as a bitmap. This is useful for generating a thumbnail for an input data source. Call this method if one does not care how the frame is found as long as it is close to the given time; otherwise, please call .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Graphics.Bitmap GetFrameAtTime (long timeUs, Android.Media.Option option);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Graphics.Bitmap GetFrameAtTime(int64 timeUs, valuetype Android.Media.Option option) cil managed

Docs.param: The time position where the frame will be retrieved. When retrieving the frame at the given time position, there is no guarantee that the data source has a frame located at the position. When this happens, a frame nearby will be returned. If timeUs is negative, time position and option will ignored, and any frame that the implementation considers as representative may be returned.

a hint on how the frame is found. Use if one wants to retrieve a sync frame that has a timestamp earlier than or the same as timeUs. Use if one wants to retrieve a sync frame that has a timestamp later than or the same as timeUs. Use if one wants to retrieve a sync frame that has a timestamp closest to or the same as timeUs. Use if one wants to retrieve a frame that may or may not be a sync frame but is closest to or the same as timeUs. often has larger performance overhead compared to the other options if there is no sync frame located at timeUs.
Docs.summary: Call this method after setDataSource().

remarks.para: Call this method after setDataSource(). This method finds a representative frame close to the given time position by considering the given option if possible, and returns it as a bitmap. This is useful for generating a thumbnail for an input data source or just obtain and display a frame at the given time position.

MemberSignature.Value: public Android.Graphics.Bitmap GetFrameAtTime (long timeUs, int option);
.method public hidebysig instance class Android.Graphics.Bitmap GetFrameAtTime(int64 timeUs, int32 option) cil managed

MemberSignature.Value: public const Android.Media.MetadataKey MetadataKeyLocation = 23;
.field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.MetadataKey MetadataKeyLocation = (23)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.MetadataKey enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: This key retrieves the location information, if available.

remarks.para: This key retrieves the location information, if available. The location should be specified according to ISO-6709 standard, under a mp4/3gp box "@xyz". Location with longitude of -90 degrees and latitude of 180 degrees will be retrieved as "-90.0000+180.0000", for instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public const Android.Media.MetadataKey MetadataKeyMimetype = 12;
.field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.MetadataKey MetadataKeyMimetype = (12)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.MetadataKey enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: The metadata key to retrieve the mime type of the data source.

remarks.para: The metadata key to retrieve the mime type of the data source. Some example mime types include: "video/mp4", "audio/mp4", "audio/amr-wb", etc.

Docs.summary: Call it when one is done with the object.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetDataSource (Java.IO.FileDescriptor fd);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetDataSource(class Java.IO.FileDescriptor fd) cil managed

Docs.param: the FileDescriptor for the file you want to play
Docs.summary: Sets the data source (FileDescriptor) to use.

remarks.para: Sets the data source (FileDescriptor) to use. It is the caller's responsibility to close the file descriptor. It is safe to do so as soon as this call returns. Call this method before the rest of the methods in this class. This method may be time-consuming.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetDataSource (string path);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetDataSource(string path) cil managed

Docs.param: The path of the input media file.
Docs.summary: Sets the data source (file pathname) to use.

remarks.para: Sets the data source (file pathname) to use. Call this method before the rest of the methods in this class. This method may be time-consuming.

Docs.param: the Context to use when resolving the Uri
the Content URI of the data you want to play
Docs.summary: Sets the data source as a content Uri.

remarks.para: Sets the data source as a content Uri. Call this method before the rest of the methods in this class. This method may be time-consuming.

Docs.exception: if the Uri cannot be used due to lack of permission.

.property instance native int ThresholdClass

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
